snippet: The judge also released many of the 49 people charged in the March killing of a woman who had been falsely accused of burning a Quran.
abstract: Afghan judge sentences four men to death for their part in mob killing of female student Farkhunda, who was falsely accused of burning a Quran in Kabul; also releases many of the 49 people charged in case, setting off protests; mixed outcome is unlikely to satisfy observers of trial.

byline.original: By AHMAD SHAKIB and ROD NORDLAND
byline.contributor: Ahmad Shakib reported from Kabul, and Rod Nordland from Rome.

lead_paragraph: The judge also released many of the 49 people charged in the March killing of a woman who had been falsely accused of burning a Quran.

headline.main: Afghan Judge Sentences 4 to Death Over Mob Killing
headline.print_headline: 4 Afghans Are to Die for Attack
